title: [Medicine] Hormone treatment makes alcoholic monkeys drink 50% less. A hormone produced by the liver called fibroblast growth factor 21 (FGF21) makes alcohol-addicted vervet monkeys cut their drinking by half, according to international scientists.

[Medicine] Shigella bacteria cause nearly one in six diarrhoea-related deaths worldwide and are the top cause of severe childhood diarrhoea in low- and middle-income countries. These pathogens are evolving resistance to crucial antibiotics, making them even more dangerous.
